title: Affinity at Serangoon outshines with resort-like design
text:
Affinity at Serangoon boasts water elements that snake 90m across its grounds, dividing the development into three man-made islands (Credit: Albert Chua/ EdgeProp Singapore)

SINGAPORE (EDGEPROP) - Affinity at Serangoon clinched the title for Landscape Excellence at the EdgeProp Singapore Excellence Awards this year.

The 296,913 sq ft development incorporates water elements that snake 90m across its grounds, dividing the development into three man-made islands that boast a clubhouse, a gym, an al-fresco kitchen and dining area, and lounge decks.

Designed by DP Architects, Affinity at Serangoon has been described by Oxley Holdings as “reminiscent of a luxury resort”, with walkways paved in timber accents, juxtaposed against a palette of grey, cedar, gold and copper to exude an aura of tranquillity.



The one-bedroom unit showflat at the development (Credit: Albert Chua/ EdgeProp Singapore)

There are a total of 88 recreational facilities at the development. These include aqua gyms, wading pools, spas and a 50m lap pool. There is also a tennis court, a reflexology path, as well as running trails and boardwalks that cut through a foliage of trees and shrubs.

As the condo is set within the mature neighbourhood of Serangoon, residents have easy access to amenities including schools, food stalls and public transport. Nearby, the Serangoon Garden Market sells traditional hawker fare that dates as far back as three generations. Eateries and cafés can be found along Maju Avenue. There is also the popular Chomp Chomp Food Centre, a hot spot among locals.

Homes at Affinity at Serangoon comprise 1,002 one- to four-bedroom units of 463 to 1,711 sq ft, 10 penthouses ranging from 1,550 to 1,701 sq ft, and 40 townhouses of between 2,056 and 2,347 sq ft. There are also five retail shops.



The three-bedroom unit offers an open-concept kitchen suitable for both Asian and Western cooking styles (Credit: Albert Chua/ EdgeProp Singapore)

As the site has been elevated, residents will be able to enjoy unobstructed views of the surrounding low-rise estate, or enjoy the verdant landscaping within the development.

Meanwhile, the townhouse units are designed with a backyard that opens to the outdoors, with views of a pool.

Each unit comes fitted with appliances from brands such as Grohe and Bosch.

The three-bedroom unit offers an open-concept kitchen suitable for both Asian and Western cooking styles. There is also a sliding glass door to enclose the kitchen space when heavy cooking is required.

Affinity at Serangoon, which sits on the former Serangoon Ville, was one of the three sites purchased by Oxley in 2017 at a cost of $499 million ($835 psf per plot ratio).

According to Oxley, former residents of the HUDC estate have returned to purchase a unit at the new development. “They really like this location and the Cross Island Line is definitely an added convenience for them,” notes Oxley. In particular, they “like how the architecture of Affinity can change the streetscape of Serangoon”.
